body: Can you please include the steps to regenerate the problem in my local environment.

Thanks for reporting!

Just for context, this is a permalink to the line of code this refers to:

https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/f784ea6f4f98a12208c9dc42d7e437280e285a06/npm/install.js#L47

@KinshukSS2 thanks for reporting this!

I agree with the change you're suggesting. It seems to correctly implement the behavior
described in [this feature's documentation](https://github.com/electron/electron/commit/f5262060957b7e32b33d64b3529a69417bdb5c26):

```diff
 If your mirror serves artifacts with different checksums to the official
-Electron release you may have to set `electron_use_remote_checksums=1` to
-force Electron to use the remote `SHASUMS256.txt` file to verify the checksum
-instead of the embedded checksums.
+Electron release you may have to set `electron_use_remote_checksums=1` directly,
+or configure it in a `.npmrc` file, to force Electron to use the remote `SHASUMS256.txt`
+file to verify the checksum instead of the embedded checksums.
```

issue.title: fix: logical bug in install.js env var handling

repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
#### Description of Change

If either `NPM_CONFIG_ELECTRON_USE_REMOTE_CHECKSUMS` or `ELECTRON_USE_REMOTE_CHECKSUMS` are set as environment variables, then force Electron to verify with remote checksums instead of embedded ones.

Fixes #48594.

Thanks to @KinshukSS2 for reporting this and suggesting a solution.

#### Checklist

- [x] PR description included and stakeholders cc'd
- [x] `npm test` passes
- [x] [PR release notes](https://github.com/electron/clerk/blob/main/README.md) describe the change in a way relevant to app developers, and are [capitalized, punctuated, and past tense](https://github.com/electron/clerk/blob/main/README.md#examples).

#### Release Notes

Notes: Fixed an error when checking environmental variables when using remote checksums when installing Electron via npm.
